snippet: The Haitian government has started a campaign to try to keep parents from sending their children away simply because they cannot afford to support them.
abstract: Port-au-Prince Journal; Haitian government has begun campaign to discourage parents from sending their children to orphanages or putting them up for adoption because they cannot afford to support them; government strategies include closing orphanages, regulating adoptions and providing job training to parents, but some question whether country is ready for new approach.

byline.contributor: Emily Brennan reported with the help of a grant from the International Reporting Project.

lead_paragraph: The Haitian government has started a campaign to try to keep parents from sending their children away simply because they cannot afford to support them.

headline.seo: Campaign in Haiti to Close Orphanages
headline.main: Trying to Close Orphanages Where Many Aren’t Orphans at All
headline.print_headline: Trying to Close Orphanages Where Many Aren’t Orphans at All
